result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommie Leon Bennett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tommie Leon Bennett in court.  Attorney Amanda J. Olsen appeared by video for Tommie Leon Bennett.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 30 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tommie Leon Bennett in court.  Attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for State of Wisconsin.  Case proceeded with an indigency hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Amanda Kremer  to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $1000.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning the 1st of the month beginning 11/1/2022 and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Status of Counsel date in branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/19/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  KM ( DOB 6/30/98)
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tommie Leon Bennett in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/17/2022@1pm
